title: Book, "Illustrations of Her Majesty's Palace at Brighton: formerly the Pavilion: executed by the command of King George the Fourth under the superintendence of John Nash... To which is prefixed a history of the Palace, by Edward Wedlake Brayley...", 1838
medium: Letterpress, etching and aquatint, on cream wove paper; brush and watercolor on white wove paper mounted on heavy tan board, lines ruled in color and gold paint
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of the Council
description: Illustrations of the Brighton Pavilion consisting of thirty-five plates on thirty-one sheets, of which seven are in monochrome aquatint, the rest outline; thirty-one plates on twenty-eight sheets all aquatint in colors.

tombstone.epitaph:
Book, "Illustrations of Her Majesty's Palace at Brighton: formerly the Pavilion: executed by the command of King George the Fourth under the superintendence of John Nash... To which is prefixed a history of the Palace, by Edward Wedlake Brayley...", 1838.
1838. Letterpress, etching and aquatint, on cream wove paper; brush and watercolor on white wove paper mounted on heavy tan board, lines ruled in color and gold paint. Museum purchase through gift of the Council. 1951-128-1.
